intro: Loncomelos pyrenaicum, commonly known as the Pyrenean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Pyrenees mountain range. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and supporting biodiversity in its habitat.
